channel.title: Compiler
channel.description:
when i try to load compiler:
heres my compiler code [code]@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end pause exit[/code]
it loads and exits really fast...
any advice... and i have javac

item.title: Compiler
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Set your class paths correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler
item.dc:creator: @Bacus23 Bacus23
item.description:
@Bacus23 wrote:

it says "javac is not recognized as an internal or external command. operable program or batch file
"

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Change it to:

@echo off
javac -g:none -nowarn -d ./Class/ ./Java/*.java
pause

Read full topic
